page.title: 12Lenborough Farms
page.content:
Farms, The{Ropers}have been on the farm at Lenborough {since 1897. }The first 250 acres were originally aquired by Mr. Richard Roper's grandfather. The 1175 acres are used for {crops}and {grassland. There are 17 farm cottages on the estate, 14 of them are used by farm labourers and retired employees. Most of the buildings on the farm have been {modernised}and many others erected.
Livestock, Mr Roper has a herd of{Dairy Shorthorn.There are 458 head of cattle including 114{milking cows. }He has a {beef}herd of 316. There are 677{sheep the lambing percentage in 1985 was 172%. There are 1351 livestock in all. They keep feeding as{self sufficient as possible to reduce puchased foods.
